intro: Tiliacora chrysobotrya, commonly known as golden leaf tiliacora, is a deciduous shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves that turn bright yellow during the dry season. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
